welcome: Squeak is an open-source Smalltalk programming system with fast execution environments for all major platforms. It features the Morphic framework, which promotes graphical, interactive application development and maintenance with low effort. Many projects have been successfully created with Squeak. They cover a wide range of domains such as education, multimedia, gaming, research, and commerce.

screenshots.caption: Tools for browsing, searching, and writing Smalltalk code
Explore run-time information in concurrent debugging sessions with direct code update support
Script, inspect, and even dissect everything in the environment
Automatic change tracking and distributed source code versioning tools

features.title: It's Smalltalk!
features.html: Everything is an object. Objects collaborate by exchanging messages to achieve the desired application behavior. The Smalltalk programming language has a concise syntax and simple execution semantics. Novice programmers are welcome and experts can engineer elegant solutions at large.

features.title: Morphic UI Framework
features.html: All graphical objects are tangible and interactively changeable. This promotes short feedback loops and low-effort application development. Morphic thus leverages the live programminge experience of traditional Smalltalk environments from a mainly text-focused domain to a graphical one.

features.title: Fast Virtual Machine
features.html: The CogVM is a virtual machine that supports Smalltalk and other dynamic languages. It's efficiency in interpreting Smalltalk byte code comes from stack-to-register mapping, just-in-time compilation, and aggressive in-line message caching.

features.title: Powerful Tooling
features.html: The dynamic Squeak environment is supported by many tools for browsing, writing, executing, and versioning Smalltalk code. Multiple debugging sessions can be served concurrently. Thanks to Morphic, tool customization has resonable effort.

features.title: Build Your Own VM
features.html: The VMMaker allows any programmer to build a customized virtual machine for any platform. A subset of Squeak/Smalltalk, called Slang, is sufficient to write almost everything of the VM. Slang code will be translated to C.

features.title: Web Development
features.html: Seaside adds the capability to Squeak of being a web server.

community.title: Squeak Mailing Lists
community.html: The Squeak community exchanges many information via mailing lists for beginners, general development, and virtual machines.

community.title: Squeak Wiki
community.html: This wiki collects many useful information about the language, its tools, and several projects. It's a wiki, so you can participate!

community.title: The Weekly Squeak
community.html: This is a blog that documents news and other events in the Squeak and Smalltalk universe.

community.title: More Mailing Lists
community.html: The Smalltalk universe spreads across many different dialects, countries, and implementations. There are more lists that communicate via distinct channels.

projects.title: Etoys
projects.html: It is a media-rich authoring environment with a simple, powerful scripted object model for many kinds of objects created by end-users that runs on many platforms, and it is free and open source. It includes 2D and 3D graphics, images, text, particles, presentations, web-pages, videos, sound and MIDI, etc.

projects.title: Scratch
projects.html: Create stories, games, and animations. Share them with the whole world! Scratch helps young people to think in a creative fashion, conclude logically, and work together. Scratch is a project of the Lifelong-Kindergarten-Group at the media lab at the MIT.

projects.title: Seaside
projects.html: "Seaside provides a layered set of abstractions over HTTP and HTML that let you build highly interactive web applications quickly, reusably and maintainably. It is based on Smalltalk, a proven and robust language that is implemented by different vendors."

projects.title: Aida
projects.html: "Aida is a Smalltalk web application framework for building complex web applications with latest seamlesly integrated HTML5 technologies for today's real-time web. MVC, REST, Mobile, WebSocket, you name it!"

projects.text: Hasso Platner Institute - Software Architecture Group
Ometa - Object oriented language for pattern matching
Phobos - XUL based platform independent desktop app framework
Newspeak Programming Language - In the tradition of Smalltalk and Self

development.title: Cog VM (Standard)
development.html: The fastest virtual machine for Squeak underlying 3D ICC's (see Projects page) Croquet-based enterprise virtual collaboration spaces software.

development.title: SqueakJS VM
development.html: An experimental Squeak VM written in pure JavaScript

development.title: RSqueak VM
development.html: An experimental Squeak VM written in RPython which incorporates PyPy's JIT Compiler

development.title: Other VMs
development.html: For more virtual machines visit: http://www.squeakvm.org
